MADRID (AP) — Former Spanish soccer boss Luis Rubiales was found guilty of sexually assaulting player Jenni Hermoso on Thursday for kissing her after the 2023 Women’s World Cup final.
The kiss sparked outrage in Spain and marred the celebrations of Spain’s first Women's World Cup title.
Hermoso testified that she “felt disrespected” by Rubiales after winning the World Cup.
The kiss prompted widespread outrage in society beyond soccer, and ignited one of the most embarrassing scandals in the history of Spanish soccer.
